title: Staggered versioner fails to keep files that have no extension

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
If you delete a file that has no file extension, the staggered versioner will move the file into the .stversions directory and then immediately expire it. Here's a log that I just captured:

```
[MAPXM] 2014/12/02 13:44:42.953451 staggered.go:288: DEBUG: Waiting for lock on  /home/mhw/projects/.stversions
[MAPXM] 2014/12/02 13:44:42.953484 staggered.go:319: DEBUG: archiving /home/mhw/projects/i915-crash/syslog
[MAPXM] 2014/12/02 13:44:42.954622 staggered.go:337: DEBUG: moving to /home/mhw/projects/.stversions/i915-crash/syslog~20140509-113558
[MAPXM] 2014/12/02 13:44:42.957397 staggered.go:226: DEBUG: Versioner: Expiring versions [/home/mhw/projects/.stversions/i915-crash/syslog~20140509-113558 /home/mhw/projects/.stversions/i915-crash/syslog~20140509-113558]
[MAPXM] 2014/12/02 13:44:42.958447 staggered.go:268: DEBUG: too many files in step -> delete /home/mhw/projects/.stversions/i915-crash/syslog~20140509-113558
```

I think the problem is that the list of files passed to `expire` includes the newly created archive file twice. `expire` then sees this as two separate backups in a time period when only one is required and so it deletes the file.

Why does `expire` get the filename passed to it twice? Because files without file extensions will be matched by both of the glob patterns used in [this section of code](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/internal/versioner/staggered.go#L344..L356). Removing duplicates from the list prior to calling `expire` should fix it I think.

Based on a quick test the simple versioner doesn't have this issue because its expiry logic is simpler.
